question: What is the position of India on Global Human Capital Index 2017?
explanation: India has been ranked 103 on Global Human Capital Index 2017 released by World Economic Forum (WEF). India has scored the least among the BRICS countries. The rankings are based on four criteria - capacity, deployment, development. The Global Human Capital Index is prepared by WEF (World Economic Forum) for 130 countries based on the knowledge and skills people possess that would find value in the global economic system.
